Question: OUSD R&E SBIR/STTR Program CES 2024 product highlight and specification
Summary:
OUSD (R&E) SBIR/STTR Program CES 2024

- Develop precision contact lens eye tracking sensors for Extended Reality (XR) interaction, training optimization, and cognitive monitoring
- Camera-based eye tracking technology lacks precision and ruggedness for military use, while a contact lens-based eye tracking technology can measure eye movement and avoid complex image processing algorithms
- Feasibility studies and prototype development for eye tracking system and sensors embedded in contact lens
- Academic research, smart contact lenses, and data transfer technologies can leverage the developed technology
- Develop and demonstrate solutions or components of solutions for terrain shaping to delay, deter, and deny enemy forces freedom of movement 70–150km+ beyond the forward line of troops (FLOT)
- Develop and demonstrate a modular medical mission payload for autonomous resupply of blood and casualty evacuation
- Foster a collaborative partnership with SpaceWERX and small businesses to develop transformative technologies for the Spaceport of the Future (SOTF) vision
- Strategic investments in digital transformation, hardware modernization, and operational enhancement of future spaceports
- Develop applied research toward an innovative water surveillance field instrument for microbiological and metal detection capabilities at point-of-need
Summary_cn:
OUSD（R&E）SBIR/STTR计划CES 2024

- 开发用于扩展现实（XR）交互、培训优化和认知监测的精密隐形眼镜眼动跟踪传感器
- 基于摄像头的眼动跟踪技术在军事使用上缺乏精确性和坚固性，而基于隐形眼镜的眼动跟踪技术可以测量眼动并避免复杂的图像处理算法
- 进行嵌入隐形眼镜的眼动跟踪系统和传感器的可行性研究和原型开发
- 学术研究、智能隐形眼镜和数据传输技术可以利用开发的技术
- 开发和演示针对地形塑造的解决方案或解决方案组件，以延缓、阻止和限制敌军自由行动范围超过前沿部队阵线（FLOT）70-150公里
- 开发和演示用于自主补给血液和伤员撤离的模块化医疗任务有效载荷
- 与SpaceWERX和小型企业建立合作伙伴关系，为未来航天港（SOTF）愿景开发具有变革性的技术
- 在数字转型、硬件现代化和未来航天港的操作增强方面进行战略投资
- 开发面向微生物和金属检测能力的创新水质监控现场仪器的应用研究能力
